Quotes: Hear reason, or she'll make you feel her.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: I became the Dalai Lama not on a volunteer basis.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quotes: You can wipe out your opponents. But if you do it unjustly you become eligible for being wiped out yourself.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: Riches are a good hand maiden, but a poor mistress.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: The man that thinks he loves his mistress for her own sake is mightily mistaken.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: A difference of taste in jokes is a great strain on the affections.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: Different taste in jokes is a great strain on the affections.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: I'm leaving because the weather is too good. I hate London when it's not raining.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: Marry me and I'll never look at another horse!
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: Her great merit is finding out mine - there is nothing so amiable as discernment.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Eroticism is like a dance: one always leads the other.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: The hidden harmony is better than the obvious.
Author: Pablo Picasso
